title: Collar, late 17th century
creditline: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf Esq. in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Long narrow scarf or collar of Point de France with elaborate floral and scroll designs in a symmetrical arrangement with figures of people scattered throughout. Figures include a woman with a long staff and a fan, boys with baskets of fruit on their heads and dolphins. The design is arranged so that the woman's figure is in the center in a medallion frame. From the center point, on the left and right, design motifs descend in an arrangement vertical with the length.

tombstone.epitaph:
Collar, late 17th century.
late 17th century. Medium: linen
Technique: needle lace. Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf Esq. in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1950-121-34.
